alert.note: Alert for Bering Strait Coast; Shishmaref (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 12 at 8:49AM AKST until December 12 at 4:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Shishmaref and Bering Strait Coast. * WHEN...Until 4 PM AKST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...In addition to reducing visibility, strong winds and waves could also lead to heavy freezing spray which may create light ice accumulations on surfaces.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult.
